<<<<<<< HEAD
A friend to the sick, or, The honest Englishman's preservation shewing the causes, symptoms, and cures of the most occult and dangerous diseases which affect the body of man : with a particular discourse of the dropsie, scurvy, and yellow jaundice, and the most absolute way of cure : whereunto is added a true relation of some of the most remarkable cures affected by the author's most famous cathartique and diueretique pills. Sermon, William, 1629?-1679.
[22], 276 p.
Printed by W. Downing for Edward Thomas ..., London : 1673.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library. Attributed to William Sermon. cf. NUC pre-1956. Epistle dedicatory signed: William Sermon. Table of contents: p. [21]-[22] Errata: p. [22] Advertisement: p. 276.
=======

Sermon, William, 1629?-1679.
[22], 276 p.
Printed by W. Downing for Edward Thomas ..., London : 1673.
